Name: Finmark Free Republic
Description:
The Finmark Free Republic was a rising periphery power that became another casualty of the First Succession War.

Between 2779 and 2782 Finmark created a government modeled on the early Rim Worlds system and managed to pull together a defense force comprised largely of fresh recruits and orphaned elements of the SLDF and the former Rim Worlds Army; these forces mustered a strength of almost two BattleMech regiments, a similar number of aerospace fighters, and enough armor and infantry units for each world in the Republic to have approximately two regiments of mixed armor and infantry each.

Finmark's influence continued to grow, with systems as far away as Inner Surge and Port Vail receiving some form of defensive support from Finmark by the late 2780s as the government worked on rebuilding as much of the former Finmark Province as possible; the government also worked to restore the orbital shipyards above Finmark, with the shipyards nearing fully operational status by the late 2780s. Unfortunately for the nascent interstellar state - and particularly the inhabitants of Finmark - the increasing savagery of the First Succession War combined with Finmark's growing strength attracted predatory attention from the Lyran Commonwealth.
ReputationStatements: I don't know why we bother offering you contracts, to be perfectly honest. It's obvious you're not a friend to the Finmark Free Republic, but desperate times require desperate measures, so we have to scrape the bottom of the barrel.
Greetings, mercenary. Lowly and despicable though you may be, you may yet serve our interests. Finish this job, and we may look upon you with more favor than you likely deserve.
The Finmark Free Republic has a use for mercenaries like you, Commander. I think you'll be interested in the attached contract. Hopefully you will find it to your liking.
The Finmark Free Republic would like to offer you a choice contract, Commander. As the leader of a respected mercenary company, you should find the terms both fair and equitable, I think.
Commander, I hope this message finds you well. The people of the Finmark Free Republic would like to offer a contract to you, owing to our respect for your skills. Please consider it carefully.

Greetings, my friend. This contract is not one we would offer to a lesser mercenary, but you've proven your loyalty, prowess, and dedication to the ideals of the Finmark Free Republic. Please accept our offer.

We both know the score, Commander. The Republic relies on you like you're one of our own, and you've always been happy to help us out. I hope you will agree to complete this contract as it is suitable to one of your stature.
MissionSuccessStatements: Top-tier work, Commander â€” The Republic is very happy with your performance. Keep it up, and I'll make sure a lot more work comes your way.
GoodFaithFailureStatements: The Finmark Free Republic understands that sacrifice on the battlefield doesn't always translate to victory. It was a valiant effort, even though it failed. Carry this loss with you so the knowledge can be used to win the next one.
BadFaithFailureStatements: We are deeply disappointed in your performance, Commander. Your efforts on the battlefield were those of a raw cadet, not the leader of a mercenary company.
